book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: The Sheikh Abu Sabir Hamid bin al-Qasim bin Ruzbah al-Ahwazi informed us, by reading upon him while I was listening, on Friday the sixteenth of Shawwal in the year six hundred and eleven. The Imam, the Hafiz Abu Tahir Ahmad bin Muhammad al-Silafi al-Asbahani informed us, by reading upon him while I was listening, on Tuesday the nineteenth of Safar in the year five hundred and seventy-three in Alexandria. Abu al-Hasan al-Mubarak bin Abd al-Jabbar al-Sayrafi informed us, by my reading upon him in Baghdad. Abu al-Qasim Hamdan bin Salman bin Hamdan bin Salman al-Salmani informed us. Abu al-Qasim Ubayd Allah bin Yahya bin Janiqa informed us. Abu Bakr Mukarram bin Ahmad bin Mukarram al-Bazzaz informed us. Abu Khalid Yazid bin al-Haytham bin Tahman al-Naqid told me, he said: I heard Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in say:

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 1 - The Tafsir (exegesis) of Ibn Uyaynah, he only took it from Muqatil; and the book of Ibn Jurayj, he took it from Harb. So he took the Tafsir from the two of them. 2 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Abu Ma'shar al-Bara' Yusuf bin Yazid is weak in Hadith. And he said another time: Salih (righteous/acceptable). 3 - Yahya told us, he said: And Hajjaj bin Muhammad told me, he said: I heard Sufyan al-Thawri say: May Allah have mercy on Abu Hazim. He said: The people were satisfied with knowledge and they abandoned action.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 4 - Yahya told us, he said: And I heard Sufyan bin Uyaynah say once: Your comfort does not come from a thing when you have reached the limit of it, [rather] you would wish for just a sufficiency of it, or that it never existed. 5 - I heard Yahya say: Al-Thawri wrote to al-Fazari: 'I warn you against this matter and its fame'—meaning the Hadith. 6 - Abu Zakariya said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: The view of Sufyan al-Thawri was Abu Bakr and Umar, then he would stop. 7 - Yahya bin Ma'in said: And it is the view of Yahya bin Sa'id. 8 - And I heard Yahya, and he was asked about a people from whom al-Ma'afi narrated, Abdullah bin Abdur-Rahman al-Ta'ifi, so he said: His hadith is not that strong.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 9 - I heard Yahya say: And Zuhayr al-Khurasani, there is no harm in him; al-Ma'afi and al-Hasan bin Hakim narrated from him. 10 - I heard Yahya say: Muqatil bin Hayyan is Thiqah (trustworthy), there is no harm in him, a righteous man. 11 - I heard Yahya say: Kharijah bin Mus'ab is not Thiqah. 12 - I heard Yahya say: Sa'id bin Muhammad al-Warraq, his hadith is nothing.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 13 - I heard Yahya say: Ata' bin al-Sa'ib, they rejected him towards the end [of his life]; and what Hushaym narrated from Husayn and Sufyan [from Ata'] is authentic, then he became confused (mixed up). (30a) 14 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: And that which is narrated from Mu'adh, that if he caught the Imam in the Tashahhud (sitting), he would pray two rak'ahs; this is a lie, there is nothing to this. It was said to him: Abu Yusuf narrated it from Abu Shaybah from al-Hakam from Mu'adh, that if he caught the Imam in the Tashahhud, he would pray two rak'ahs. So he said: A lie, false.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 15 - It was said to Yahya: Al-A'mash from Ata' bin al-Sa'ib? He said: Yes. 16 - It was said to him: Did Qatadah narrate from Khilas? He said: He did narrate, but Yahya did not mention whether there was hearing (Sama') in it or not.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 17 - I heard Yahya say: Amr bin al-Walid bin al-Aghdaf was a judge; I did not write from him, I do not know him. 18 - Abdur-Rahman bin Abdullah al-Umari is not Thiqah; he used to say 'My father told me' and 'Ubayd Allah [told me]' equally, exactly the same. 19 - I said to him: Is Yazid bin Zuray' older than Ibn Ulayyah? He said: He is not [to be compared] to him; a man who did not hear from Ibn Ulayyah. 20 - I heard Yahya say: Hisham bin Hassan is Thiqah. 21 - And Abu Hamzah Imran bin Abi Ata is Thiqah.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 22 - And Abu Hamzah al-Thumali is weak. 23 - Wasil bin al-Sa'ib al-Raqashi is not Thiqah. 24 - And Muhammad bin Amr is Thiqah; Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan and others narrated from him. 25 - I heard Yahya, and he was asked about a hadith narrated by Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, but he did not pay attention to it. He said: Shu'bah did not narrate it, nor did Sufyan; had they narrated it, Abu Bakr would have been Saduq (truthful/credible). 26 - I heard Yahya, and he was asked about Muhammad bin Ziyad, the one from whom Shu'bah narrated, so he said: Thiqah.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 27 - I heard Yahya say: Ibn Idris is better than Ibn Fudayl a hundred times, but Ibn Fudayl has better [presented] hadith than him. 28 - I heard Yahya say: Muhammad bin Abi al-Raziqi is a Sheikh who is not 'all that'; Abdur-Rahman narrated from him. 29 - I heard Yahya, and the hadith of al-Mukhtar bin Fulful was mentioned to him, which he narrates from Anas bin Malik regarding Nabidh (date-wine), so he said: Mukhtar is Thiqah. 30 - I said to Yahya: Abu al-Nadr narrates from Abu Kurz? He said: He is nothing; I do not know him, he narrated a Munkar (denounced) hadith.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 31 - I said to Yahya: Yahya bin Sa'id al-Qattan narrates from Sharik? He said: Sharik was not considered anything by Yahya, yet he is Thiqah. 32 - I heard Yahya say: Sharik is Thiqah, and he is more beloved to me than Abu al-Ahwas; and Jarir cannot be measured against Sharik; and he narrates from people from whom Sufyan did not narrate. 33 - I heard Yahya, he was asked about Salm, Aban bin Abi Ayyash, and Yazid al-Raqashi, so he said: They are nothing. 34 - I heard Yahya say: Muhammad bin Rashid is Thiqah, and he was a Qadari.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 35 - And Kharijah b. Abdullah b. Sulayman b. Zayd b. Thabit is nothing. 36 - And Rishdin b. Sa'd is nothing. 37 - Al-Husayn b. Ulwan (30b) is not trustworthy. 38 - And Abu al-Atuf al-Jazari is not trustworthy. 39 - And Talhah b. Yahya is trustworthy. 40 - And his brother Ishaq is nothing. 41 - And Sulayman b. Dawud al-Shami narrated from al-Zuhri.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: The Hadith of Amr b. Hazm; he is nothing.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 42 - And Sulayman b. Dawud al-Yamami is nothing. 43 - And no one followed Sulayman b. Dawud in the Hadith of Amr b. Hazm, and there is no Isnad (chain of transmission) for the [Hadith of] Alms belonging to him. 44 - And the Hadith of Mu'adh 'When the sky waters...' is not narrated by anyone except Abu Bakr b. Ayyash, and he is not strong.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 45 - And Uqbah al-Asam is nothing. 46 - And Uqbah b. Abi al-Sahba' is trustworthy. 47 - Zayd al-Ammi is nothing. 48 - The sons of Zayd b. Aslam: Abdur-Rahman and Abdullah, all of them, there is no trustworthy one among them; Usamah b. Zayd is more established than them.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 49 - I asked Yahya about Sufyan al-Sa'di, so he said: He is nothing; Abu Mu'awiyah narrated from him. 50 - I said: Nuh b. Qays? He said: A little Sheikh (Shuwaykh), Salih al-Hadith (acceptable in Hadith). 51 - I said: Qaza'ah b. Suwayd? He said: He is not that strong, but he is Salih.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 52 - I heard Yahya say: Al-Ajlah al-Kindi is Salih al-Hadith. I said: He narrated the Hadith of Zayd b. Arqam regarding drawing lots from Abdullah b. Abi al-Khalil? Some of them said Abdullah b. Khalil. He said: They doubt his name.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 53 - I said to him: Ali b. Sarah, Ishaq narrated from him? He said: He is nothing; [he is] Basran. 54 - I said: Daylam b. Ghazwan? He said: Salih; he narrates three or four Hadiths. 55 - He said: And Yahya b. Abi Anisah is not trustworthy. 56 - I said: Isma'il b. Umayyah from Bujayr b. Bujayr? He said: I do not know who he is, I do not know him; it is like this in the Hadith 'I do not know him.' 57 - It was said to Abu Zakariya: He narrated regarding the heretics (Zanadiqah) from Ali? He said: The Hadith of Qabus b. al-Mukhariq, Abu Salamah narrated it from Simak from Qabus b. Mukhariq from his father. And Sufyan narrated it from Simak from Qabus. And the Hadith is the Hadith of Sufyan, it is the more correct of the two.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 58 - Shu'bah also narrated regarding cutting [the hand] for a quarter of a Dinar and upwards, the Hadith of al-Zuhri; no one else narrated it. And others contradicted him, and he did not raise it [attribute it directly to the Prophet]: Abu...

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: ...Sufyan, who narrates from Jabir. And it was said to him, so he said: If only he could correct himself, then how can he correct others?

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 59 - I heard Yahya say: Al-A'mash heard from Mujahid, and everything he narrates from him [where] he did not hear [directly], is only Mursal (disconnected) and Mudallas (obfuscated). 60 - It was said to Yahya: Did anyone attack [criticize] Qatadah? He said: Trustworthy. 61 - And Thabit is trustworthy. 62 - Zam'ah b. Salih is weak in Hadith. 63 - Asim b. Kulayb is trustworthy, Ma'mun (trusted/secure). I heard Yahya say: Jarir said he was a Murji', meaning Asim b. Kulayb. 64 - It was said to him: But Jarir did not narrate from al-Aswad b. Qays? He said: Al-Aswad is better than him and his father; he narrates from the pickpockets (Tarrarin). We did not see him. All the time Jarir sought Hadith was five years, ten thousand Hadiths. It was said to him (31a): Did he use to practice Tadlis (obfuscation)? He said: If only he knew how to narrate what he had! He did not know how to practice Tadlis. He only practices Tadlis regarding every [narrator] who has a devil. And Jarir is Saduq (truthful), trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 65 - Al-Ahwas b. Hakim is not trustworthy nor Ma'mun. 66 - And Ash'ath b. Sawar is weak in Hadith. 67 - And Abu Yahya al-A'raj is trustworthy, the one who narrates from Husayn.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 68 - And Ash'ath b. Abi al-Sha'tha' is trustworthy. 69 - Uyaynah b. Abdur-Rahman is trustworthy, and his father is trustworthy. 70 - Bashir b. Sulayman is not trustworthy. 71 - Amr b. Shu'ayb is trustworthy. It was said to him: Regarding what he narrates from his father? He said: That is what the People of Hadith say. I said to him: It was a Sahifah (script/book)? He said: Yes. 72 - And Ghassan b. Mudar is trustworthy. 73 - And I heard Yahya, and he was asked about Abdul-Hamid b. Ja'far al-Ansari, so he said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 74 - And I heard him say: Qurrah b. Khalid al-Sadusi is trustworthy. 75 - And Hilal b. Salman Abu Muhallim is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 76 - And Abu Hilal, there is no harm in him. 77 - And Musa b. Ubaydah is weak. 78 - And Rabi'ah b. Kulthum b. Jabr, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 79 - And Ayyub b. Utbah is weak, and he narrated a Hadith from Abu Kathir regarding wine, meaning Abu Kathir al-Ghubari. 80 - And Sa'd b. Aws al-Absi, there is no harm in him. 81 - Uqbah b. Abi al-Sahba', there is no harm in him. 82 - Abu Ja'far al-Razi, there is no harm in him. 83 - And Sa'id b. Jahman, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 84 - And Bashir b. Zadhan was towards Medina; he narrates from Rishdin, he is nothing. 85 - And Abu Layla al-Khurasani is not trustworthy. 86 - And Muhill al-Dabbi is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 87 - And Muhammad b. Salman al-Makki, there is no harm in him. 88 - And al-Qasim b. al-Fadl al-Haddani, there is no harm in him, trustworthy. 89 - Musa b. Ubaydullah b. Ishaq b. Talhah, I do not know him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 90 - And Istabraq, he said: I asked Salim [about him], there is no harm in him. 91 - And Ibrahim b. Tahman is Salih al-Hadith. 92 - And Ubaydullah b. Abdur-Rahman b. Mawhab, there is no harm in him. 93 - And Ikrimah b. Ammar, there is no harm in him. 94 - And Muhammad b. Jabir is not trustworthy. 95 - And Abdu-Rabbih b. Abi Rashid is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 96 - Abdul-Hamid b. Bahram, there is no harm in him; he possessed a Sahifah. 97 - And al-Salt b. Dinar is nothing. 98 - Ubayd b. Abi Wasim is trustworthy. 99 - I heard Yahya, and Ata' b. Yazid and Sa'id b. al-Musayyib were mentioned to him, that they agreed on the Hadith of the Vision [of Allah]. He said: Ata' b. Yazid is trustworthy, sufficient (Kifayah).

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 100 - And I heard Yahya say: Abu al-Umayyis Utbah b. Abdullah b. Utbah b. Mas'ud is trustworthy, and his brother Abdur-Rahman b. Abdullah al-Mas'udi is trustworthy. 101 - Hamzah al-Zayyat, there is no harm in him, trustworthy. 102 - Shahr b. Hawshab is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 103 - And Abdullah b. Subrah, there is no harm in him. 104 - And Abu al-Awwam al-Bahili, there is no harm in him. 105 - Malik b. Mighwal is trustworthy. 106 - Isa b. al-Musayyib is weak.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 107 - Mutarrif Abu Bakr al-Shaqri is trustworthy. 108 - Mutarrif b. Tarif (31b) is trustworthy. 109 - Hisham al-Dastawa'i is trustworthy. 110 - I said to Yahya b. Ma'in: Who is greater regarding Abu Ishaq: Sharik or Sufyan? He said: Sufyan. I said: And Sharik or Shu'bah? He said: Shu'bah. I said: So Shu'bah or Sufyan? He said: They are all one. Then he said: Zuhayr, Isra'il, Sharik, and Abu Awanah; these four regarding Abu Ishaq are one. And Isra'il is older than Isa; there is no harm in him. 111 - And Hurayth b. Abi Matar is nothing.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 112 - And Aban b. Sam'ah is trustworthy. 113 - Yunus b. Abi Ishaq is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 114 - And Ali and al-Hasan, the sons of Salih, are two trustworthy ones, there is no harm in them. 115 - And Abdullah al-Umari is Salih, there is no harm in him. 116 - And Mu'adh b. al-Ala Abu Ghassan is Basran, trustworthy. 117 - And his brother Abu Sufyan b. al-Ala and Abu Amr b. al-Ala, there is no harm in them; [they are] Basrans.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 118 - Uqbah b. Abi al-Ayzar, there is no harm in him. 119 - Jarir b. Ayyub al-Bajali al-Kufi is weak. 120 - And his brother Yahya b. Ayyub is Salih al-Hadith. 121 - And Yahya b. Ayyub al-Masri, there is no harm in him. 122 - Ali b. al-Mubarak, there is no harm in him, trustworthy. 123 - Amr b. Hukkam is not trustworthy. 124 - Al-Qarqasani, Muslim, the companion of campaigning (Ghazw), does not know what he narrates.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 125 - Umar b. Habib is not trustworthy. 126 - Waqid b. Abdullah, there is no harm in him. 127 - Talhah b. Amr is nothing. 128 - Tu'mah al-Ja'fari is trustworthy. 129 - I said: Do you mean by al-Qarqasani, Muhammad b. Mus'ab? He said: Yes, he is Muhammad b. Mus'ab al-Qarqasani. 130 - Muhammad b. al-Hajjaj, I wrote from him, and they told me that he narrated Hadiths that are nothing—meaning the one who used to be in the Masjid.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 131 - And Abdul-Aziz b. Muslim al-Qasmali is trustworthy. 132 - His brother Mughirah b. Muslim is the Saddler (Sarraj) of al-Mada'in. 133 - Abdullah b. Habib b. Abi Thabit and his brother Ubaydullah are two trustworthy ones. 134 - And the companion of Sa'id b. Abdul-Aziz, the one who used to pray in the Masjid and narrate, is not trustworthy; he used to pray often.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 135 - Ubaydah b. Mu'attib narrated from Ibrahim, he is nothing. 136 - Hanzalah al-Jumahi is trustworthy. 137 - Muhammad b. Qays is trustworthy. 138 - Shu'ayb b. Abi Hamzah, there is no harm in him; he is more knowledgeable about al-Zuhri than Yunus and Ma'mar; and Malik b. Anas is the most trustworthy of people regarding al-Zuhri. 139 - Hawshab b. Uqayl al-Abdi is trustworthy.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 140 - Al-Hasan bin Sawwar: There is no harm in him. 141 - Omar bin Harun: He is not trustworthy. 142 - Omar bin Habib: He is not trustworthy. 143 - Aflah bin Humaid: Trustworthy. 144 - Abu Talq Al-A'idhi: Trustworthy. 145 - I heard Yahya being asked who is more trustworthy, Bishr bin Harb or Abu Harun Al-Abdi? He said: Bishr cannot be compared to him; Abu Harun is nothing in Hadith nor in anything else.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 146 - Yazid Al-Raqashi and Aban bin Abi Ayyash: They are nothing. 147 - It was said to Yahya while I was listening: Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman narrated from Ubaidullah from Nafi from Ibn Omar that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Raml (hastened pace) from the Stone to the Stone. He said: I do not know him. 148 - And I heard Yahya say: Ubaidullah bin Omar is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 149 - And Abdullah (32 a) his brother: There is no harm in him. 150 - And I heard Yahya say: Abdullah bin Yahya bin Abi Kathir was not among the people of Hadith. 151 - And Yahya was asked while I was listening about Humaid Al-Shami, Sulayman Al-Munabbihi narrates from him from Thawban. He said: I do not know him. 152 - And I heard Yahya say: Abu Maysarah Amr bin Shurahbil, Uraib bin Humaid narrated from him.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 153 - And Abu Ammar is a famous Kufi Sheikh. 154 - Za'idah bin Abi Al-Ruqad is nothing. 155 - Zadhan was trustworthy, he used to issue fatwas then he repented. 156 - Maymuna bint Madh'ur, the Basrans narrated from her. 157 - Asim bin Bahdala is trustworthy, there is no harm in him, and he is a peer of Al-A'mash, but Al-A'mash is more established than him.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 158 - And the name of Abu Al-Wazi' is Zuhair bin Malik. 159 - Asim bin Damrah is trustworthy, a Shi'ite; Abu Ishaq narrated from him. 160 - And Hammad bin Abi Sulayman is trustworthy. 161 - Asim bin Bahdala is more established than Asim Al-Ahwal. 162 - And Abdullah bin Ayyash, there is no harm in him; how close he is to Abu Isra'il Al-Mula'i. Abu Isra'il used to be extreme in Shi'ism.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 163 - Salih Al-Murri is a storyteller, he is nothing. 164 - Sawwar Al-Basri, Waki' narrated from him, he is nothing. Waki' used to flip his name, saying 'Abu Hamza', [he is] famous. 165 - Qurrah bin Habib: I do not know him. 166 - Mulazim bin Amr: Trustworthy. 167 - Ikrimah bin Ammar is more established than Ayyub bin Utbah. 168 - Isa bin Al-Musayyib is weak.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 169 - Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Fazari is nothing. 170 - Muhammad bin Ubaidullah Al-Arzami is nothing. 171 - Muhammad bin Abi Hafsah is not that strong, like Al-Nu'man bin Rashid regarding Al-Zuhri. 172 - Muhammad bin Abi Hafsah is nothing. 173 - And Salih bin Abi Al-Akhdar is nothing. 174 - Abu Jami', there is no harm in him. 175 - Al-Harith bin Ubaid is weak in Hadith.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 176 - Sufyan bin Husain is trustworthy in other than Al-Zuhri. 177 - Ja'far bin Sulayman Al-Dub'i is trustworthy, he has Shi'ite leanings, there is no harm in him. 178 - And I heard Yahya being asked about Yahya bin Zakariya, so he said: Trustworthy, what about him? It was said to him that Zakariya bin Adi did not narrate from him. He said: He is better than Zakariya bin Adi, and his father, and the people of his village. 179 - And I heard him saying: Qurrah bin Abdul-Rahman bin Haywil is Egyptian, not strong in Hadith. 180 - Ziyad bin Jubayr, what about him that he is asked about? He is trustworthy.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 181 - And Sa'id bin Ubaid Al-Basri is trustworthy. 182 - Al-Sari bin Yahya is trustworthy. 183 - And Mu'awiyah bin Abdul-Karim, there is no harm in him. 184 - And Humaid Al-A'raj is trustworthy, and he is the brother of Sandal. 185 - As for Sandal, he is a liar, and his name is Omar bin Qays. 186 - And Humaid Al-Kufi is weak. 187 - And I heard him being asked about Sumayy, the Mawla of Abu Bakr, so he said: Trustworthy. It was said to him: Is Sumayy more (in status) or Suhail? He said: Sumayy is more than Suhail a hundred times.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 188 - And I heard him say: Malik bin Mighwal is firm, trustworthy. 189 - And Khalaf bin Khalifa, there is no harm in him. 190 - Abu Hafs Al-Abbar, there is no harm in him. 191 - Yazid Al-Rishk, there is no harm in him. 192 - Abu Ya'fur Al-Kabir is trustworthy (32 b), there is no harm in him; and the Younger (Al-Saghir), both of them are trustworthy. 193 - Qabus bin Abi Zabyan, there is no harm in him. 194 - Sa'id bin Muhammad Al-Warraq is nothing.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 195 - Husain and Ata were both denounced at the end (of their lives). 196 - Muqatil bin Hayyan was trustworthy. 197 - Ubaid bin Abi Al-Ja'd is not the brother of Salim bin Abi Al-Ja'd. 198 - Munkadir bin Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, his Hadith is not that strong. 199 - Yahya bin Uqbah bin Abi Al-Ayzar is a Kufi Sheikh, not trustworthy, he lies.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 200 - And I heard him being asked about Muhammad bin Ali, did he hear from Umm Salama? He said: He narrated in a Mursal (disconnected) manner, and she lived long - meaning Umm Salama. 201 - And I heard him say: Aisha died before Umm Salama, may Allah be pleased with her; and Aisha and Abu Huraira died in the year fifty-five. 202 - I heard Yahya being asked: Did Shu'ba hear from Abu Ma'shar? He said: Two or three Hadiths. 203 - And I heard him being asked about five of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who offered Salam on the funeral with one Taslimah. He said: As for Ibn Abbas and Abu Huraira, one Taslimah is famous from them.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 204 - I heard Yahya say: Waki' and Ibn Numair used to drink Nabidh (date/raisin drink), and their Nabidh was what they put in the oven (Tanur), drinking it for a day, two days, or three, then pouring it out; and they would not drink every Nabidh that increases in quality with aging. 205 - And I heard Yahya say: Sharik, Sufyan, Waki', and all those who permitted it from the Kufis, all of them dislike the aged (Al-Mu'taq) [Nabidh]. And I heard him say: Ibrahim said: 'Whoever gets drunk from Nabidh, there is no Hadd (punishment) on him.' And Yahya said: 'Upon him is the greatest of punishments, one does not pray behind him, there is no honor [for him], and he is beaten as well.' And Yahya said: 'If he drank it on its day [fresh], we dislike it.'

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 206 - I heard Yahya say: Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali, his name is [So-and-so] bin Abd. 207 - And I heard him say: The Hadith of Khuzaima regarding wiping (Al-Mas-h) is authentic. And the Hadith of Al-Qasim bin Mukhaymirah, and he is a trustworthy Syrian.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 208 - And I heard him say: Shuraih bin Hani is a trustworthy Kufan who moved to Sham. 209 - And Dawud bin Amr, Hushaym narrated from him; there is no harm in him, and he is a Hashimi who came to Wasit. 210 - And Hatim bin Ismail is Kufi, a Tayyan - he sells figs. 211 - Salih bin Omar Al-Wasiti is trustworthy. 212 - Sahl bin Sa'd, Abdul-Rahman bin Azhar, Al-Sa'ib, Mahmoud bin Al-Rabi', Anas bin Malik, Ibn Abi Su'ayr, and Abu Al-Tufayl Amir bin Wathilah - these narrated from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Al-Zuhri narrated from them: seven individuals.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 213 - I heard Yahya say: Hajjaj bin Artat is Salih Al-Hadith (acceptable in Hadith). 214 - Al-Walid bin Abi Thawr is nothing. 215 - And Hudayj bin Mu'awiyah, his Hadith is not written; he is nothing, he is not trustworthy. 216 - Adi bin Al-Fadl is Basri, he is not trustworthy. 217 - Ibn Bakkar is trustworthy. 218 - Abu Dawud Al-Nakha'i is a bad man, a liar, he fabricates Hadiths. We left Hushaym regarding chapters of Divorce, so he said: 'There is nothing of it except that I have it with a chain.' He used to enter (33 a), fabricate Hadith, then come out. And I heard Yahya say: I heard Abu Dawud Al-Nakha'i say: 'Khasif, Khassaf, and Mukhsif told me' - all of it is lies.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 219 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Abu Dawud Nufay' is nothing, Al-A'mash narrated from him. 220 - And Al-Haitham bin Adi is nothing. 221 - Abu Al-Bakhtari the Judge is not trustworthy nor trusted. 222 - And Ammar bin Ukht (nephew of) Sufyan, there is no harm in him. 223 - And his brother Sayf is a liar, a bad man; and Ammar is the elder of the two. 224 - And I heard Yahya being asked: Who narrated the most from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace? Ibn Omar, Ibn Abbas, and Abu Huraira. He remained silent as if it was as he was asked.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 225 - And I heard Yahya say: Al-Afriqi Abdul-Rahman bin Ziyad is weak in Hadith. 226 - And Abu Idam Al-Muharibi bin Zaid is nothing. 227 - Ruhayl, there is no harm in him, trustworthy.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 228 - Zuhair bin Mu'awiyah is trustworthy, trusted. 229 - Abu Yahya Al-Qattat, there is no harm in him. 230 - I heard Yahya say: Ibn Abbas narrated from Abu Huraira, and Anas from Ibn Abbas. It was said to him: Did Abu Huraira narrate from Ka'b? He remained silent. 231 - I heard Yahya say: Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan narrated from Amr bin Khalid, and Amr bin Khalid is a liar.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 232 - And I heard Yahya say: Attaf, there is no harm in him. 233 - And Habib bin Hajar Al-Absi, there is no harm in him. 234 - I heard Yahya being asked about the Hadiths of Ayyub, the difference between Ibn Ulayyah and Hammad bin Zaid. He said: Ayyub used to memorize, and perhaps he forgot something. 235 - Yahya bin Ma'in told us, Abdul-Samad bin Al-Tannuri - meaning Ibn Abdul-Warith - informed us, from his father, from Ayyub that when he came to Basra he would say: 'Take it fresh before it changes.' And he did not used to write, nor dictate.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 236 - It was said to Yahya while I was listening: Shu'bah considered abandoning the Hadith of Ayyub. He said: Ayyub was better than Shu'bah, but [he thought this] due to the fact that he used to memorize and did not write. 237 - I heard Yahya say: Ayyub said: 'When the righteous are mentioned, I am far removed from them.' 238 - And Yunus b. Ubayd said: 'I count a hundred traits of goodness, and I do not possess a single one of them.' 239 - I heard Yahya say: Ayyub, Yunus b. Ubayd, and Ibn Awn, these are the best of people—or as he said—and Sulayman al-Taymi is also like them—or as he said. 240 - I heard Yahya bin Ma'in say: Talhah was 'Uthmani (pro-Uthman) and Zubayd was 'Alawi (pro-Ali).

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 241 - I heard Yahya say: Husayn al-Mu'allim is trustworthy (Thiqah), there is no harm in him. 242 - And Imran b. Muslim is Kufan, trustworthy. 243 - And Amr b. Amir narrated from Anas; there is no harm in him, trustworthy. 244 - Mujahid b. Abi Rashid is trustworthy; he is the brother of Rabi' b. Abi Rashid. 245 - And Muhajir Abu al-Hasan is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 246 - And Zuhayr b. Abi Thabit is trustworthy. 247 - And Abu al-Juwayriyah al-Jarmi, Amr b. Uthman b. Mawhab, is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 248 - Ali b. al-Aqmar is trustworthy. 249 - Wasil b. al-Sa'ib is weak in Hadith. 250 - Muhammad b. Abdur-Rahman, the client of the family of Talhah, there is no harm in him. 251 - Ali b. Badhimah, Khasif (33b), and Abdul-Karim are from Jazira; they are trustworthy, there is no harm in them. Abdul-Karim is the highest of them, trustworthy. 252 - And Abdul-Karim al-Basri Abu Umayyah b. Abi al-Mukhariq, his Hadith is nothing.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 253 - And Abdullah b. Hanash is trustworthy. 254 - And Abdullah b. Ism—he is Ibn Ismah—Abu al-Jahhaf, there is no harm in him; he narrated from Ikrimah. 255 - And Muhammad b. Juhadah is trustworthy. 256 - Atiyyah al-Awfi, there is no harm in him. It was said: Is he used as proof? He said: There is no harm in him. 257 - Abu al-Wazi' al-Nahdi is trustworthy, Kufan; Sufyan al-Thawri and Isra'il narrated from him. 258 - Abu Ja'far al-Farra' is Kufan, trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 259 - Yazid b. Maysarah is Basran, trustworthy. 260 - Ali b. Abi Talhah, Budayl narrated from him in Tafsir (exegesis), and he did not hear anything from Ibn Abbas, so he narrated as Mursal (disconnected). 261 - And Ata' al-Khurasani Ibn Maysarah, and he did not hear from Ibn Abbas. 262 - Abdur-Rahman b. Ajlan is trustworthy, Kufan; he narrates three Hadiths. 263 - Abdul-Malik b. Abi Bashir, there is no harm in him. 264 - Al-Zabriqan is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 265 - Al-Mughirah b. Nu'man is trustworthy. 266 - Abdullah b. Abi Jamilah narrates from his father; there is no harm in him. 267 - Hayyan the Carpet Seller (Bayya' al-Anmat) is trustworthy. 268 - Abu Khalid Yazid b. Abdur-Rahman al-Dalani, there is no harm in him. 269 - Ibrahim b. Muhammad b. al-Muntashir is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 270 - And Harun b. Ri'ab is trustworthy. 271 - Abdullah b. Ubayd b. Umayr is trustworthy. 272 - Marzuq Abu Bakr, the Mu'adhin of [Bani] Taym, is trustworthy. 273 - Sinan Abu Habib is trustworthy. 274 - Imran b. Dinar is trustworthy. 275 - Hajiz b. Abdullah al-Muharibi is trustworthy. 276 - Abu Malik al-Ashja'i is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 277 - I heard Yahya say, and he was asked about Salm al-Alawi, so he said: There is no harm in him. Ahmad b. Abdus-Salam said: Isn't he the one Shu'bah says about 'That is the one who sees the crescent moon'? He said: There is no harm in him; he used to see the crescent moon before the people, he had sharp eyesight. 278 - I heard Yahya say: Abu Sa'id al-Mu'addib is trustworthy; Ibn Mahdi narrated from him. 279 - Abu Isma'il al-Mu'addib, there is no harm in him, trustworthy. 280 - Isma'il b. Zakariya, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 281 - Anbasah b. Abdul-Wahid al-Qurashi, there is no harm in him. 282 - Yahya b. Sa'id al-Amawi is from the people of truth (Ahl al-Sidq), there is no harm in him. 283 - Yahya b. Tha'labah al-Ansari Abu al-Muqawwim is nothing. 284 - Shu'ayb b. Safwan is nothing; al-Tarjumani narrates from him, and he does not care from whom he narrates.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 285 - Abu Ma'shar: Write the Hadith of Muhammad b. Ka'b in Tafsir. As for the Hadiths of Nafi' and others, he is nothing; the Tafsir is good. 286 - Abdullah b. Bishr is trustworthy; Ma'mar al-Jazari narrated from him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: From al-Zuhri regarding the cupper and the cupped; he is trustworthy, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 287 - Hayyaj b. Bastam is nothing. 288 - Dimam b. Isma'il (34a), there is no harm in him. 289 - Al-Darawardi: What he narrated from his book is more established than his memory.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 290 - Abdur-Rahman b. Abdullah al-Umari is not trustworthy, and he had a handsome face. 291 - Abdul-Hamid b. al-Hasan al-Hilali is nothing. 292 - Al-Hasan b. Yazid al-Asam narrates from al-Suddi; he is trustworthy. 293 - Muhammad b. Rashid al-A'ma is trustworthy. 294 - Muhammad b. Thabit al-Asri narrated; he is weak, he narrated the Hadith of Tayammum (dry ablution). 295 - Abu Umayyah b. Ya'la is not trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 296 - Makhul narrated from Abu Hind al-Dari, Anas, and Wathilah b. al-Asqa' from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. 297 - Layth b. Sa'd is trustworthy. 298 - Ibn Lahi'ah is nothing. It was said to Yahya: 'So what about what people relate, that his books were burned?' He said: 'There is no basis for this; I asked about it in Egypt.' 299 - Salam b. Miskin, Qatadah, Sa'id, al-Dastawa'i, and Hammam leaned towards [the doctrine of] Qadar.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 300 - I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: Marwan narrated from Abdur-Rahman b. Abi Shumaylah from Ubaydullah b. Muhsan al-Ansari from his father; does he have companionship? He said: It seems so.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 301 - Hakim b. Nafi' al-Raqqi is weak in Hadith. 302 - Ma'mar b. Muhammad al-Madini is nothing. 303 - Ali b. Thabit: What he narrated from the trustworthy ones is trustworthy. 304 - Hammad b. Yahya al-Abbah, there is no harm in him. 305 - Sa'd b. Tarif is nothing. 306 - Uthman b. Abi Sulayman from Alqamah b. Nadlah; he [Alqamah] does not have companionship, it is Mursal (disconnected). 307 - Mandal and Hibban, the sons of Ali al-Anazi; Salih (acceptable), his Hadith is not that strong. He and his brother are the same thing.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 308 - Salamah b. Wardan is weak in Hadith. 309 - Musa b. Qays al-Saghir, there is no harm in him. 310 - Abu Aql, he narrated from Bahiyyah, he was in Baghdad; weak. 311 - Ibrahim b. Ziyad al-Qurashi, I do not know him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 312 - Sayf and Sinan, the sons of Harun al-Burjumi, are both weak in Hadith, and Sinan is slightly better than him. 313 - Al-Rabi' b. Badr is not trustworthy. 314 - Fayid, the client (Mawla) of Ubadil, there is no harm in him; [he is] Medinan. 315 - Fayid Abu al-Warqa', the Kufans narrated from him; he is not trustworthy. 316 - I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: Did Layth b. Sa'd meet Ibn Shihab? He said: Yes. 317 - Isma'il b. Mujalid is Salih (righteous/acceptable). 318 - Al-Ala' Abu Muhammad al-Thaqafi is not trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 319 - Abu al-Zubayr is stronger than Abu Sufyan. 320 - Abu Hariz, the Judge of Sijistan; there is no harm in him. 321 - Al-Abbas b. Dharih (34b), there is no harm in him. 322 - I said to Yahya: Ishaq b. Abi Isra'il claimed that Sharik narrated more from the Kufans than Sufyan and was more knowledgeable about their Hadith. He said: No one can be measured against Sufyan; however, Sharik narrated more than him from some of the Sheikhs, [like] al-Rukin and al-Abbas b. Dharih and some Sheikhs—meaning the Kufans—meaning he had more writings. 323 - I heard Yahya say: The companions of Sufyan are Yahya b. Sa'id, Ibn al-Mubarak, and Ibn Mahdi. I said: Al-Ashja'i? He said: Al-Ashja'i [is one], but those who narrate from him... how little the Kufans wrote from him!

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 324 - I heard Yahya say: I witnessed Ibn Abi al-Layth saying to Hushaym: 'If you say "He informed us" (Akhbarana) [we will write], otherwise we will not write a letter from you.' So I said to him: 'I am part of this speech.' Yahya said: 'I am a witness to that gathering.' So Hushaym said to him: 'The house is not lonely with you here.' Then he left him and stood up. 325 - I heard Yahya say: Al-Wazi' b. Nafi' is nothing. 326 - And Ibrahim b. Khuthaym b. Arak is nothing. 327 - Yazid b. Harun wrote from al-Jariri after he had become confused (mixed up). I think he said: I heard Yazid say that. And Yazid heard from Ibn Abi Arubah before he was denounced in Kufa, but his hearing from al-Jariri is mixed.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 328 - I said: So Abdul-A'la and Yazid b. Zuray'? He said: These [men] wrote before al-Jariri and Sa'id were denounced. 329 - I said to him: Ata' b. al-Sa'ib and Husayn became confused? He said: Yes. I said: Who has the soundest hearing from them? He said: Sufyan is the soundest of them—meaning al-Thawri—and Hushaym from Husayn. I said: So where does Jarir stand? He did not pay attention to him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 330 - And Yazid b. Ata' is nothing. 331 - Al-Ala' b. Abdul-Jabbar, there is no harm in him. 332 - Umm Shabib is trustworthy; Hammad b. Salamah and Salam b. Abi Muti' narrated from her. 333 - It was said to him: What about Shumaysah? He said: Trustworthy; Shu'bah, Ibn Abi Hazim, and al-Darawardi narrated from her; there is no harm in her.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 334 - And Muhammad b. al-Fadl b. Atiyyah, Khurasani, is a liar (Kadhdhab). 335 - Al-Zubayr b. Sa'id al-Hashimi is nothing. 336 - It was said to him: Al-Zuhri narrated from Mahmud b. al-Rabi' from Ubadah al-Samit from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever does not read the Opening of the Book (Al-Fatihah)...' And Ibn Awn narrated from Raja' b. Haywah from Mahmud b. al-Rabi' from Qatadah as Mawquf (stopped/not attributed to the Prophet). He said: He did narrate it, and al-Zuhri is sound in Hadith, trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 337 - Dawud b. Husayn is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 338 - It was said to him: Does al-Ala' b. Abdur-Rahman approximate him? He said: No, he is Salih al-Hadith (acceptable in Hadith). 339 - Abdullah b. Dinar is trustworthy. 340 - And his son Abdur-Rahman b. Abdullah b. Dinar is not that strong, though Yahya narrated from him. 341 - Abu al-Zinad is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 342 - Ibn Lahi'ah is nothing, whether he changed or did not change. 343 - Safwan b. Sulaym (35a) is trustworthy. It was said to him: Does he approximate Zayd b. Aslam and those? He said: Yes. 344 - Sa'id b. Abdur-Rahman b. Ruqaysh, there is no harm in him. 345 - Abdur-Rahman b. al-Qasim is trustworthy; he is not to be asked about. 346 - Yazid b. Abdullah b. Qusayt is trustworthy. 347 - Yazid b. Khusayfah is trustworthy. 348 - Yazid b. Hazim is trustworthy, Basran. 349 - Abdur-Rahman b. Harmalah, there is no harm in him. It was said to Yahya: They say he heard from Sa'id b. al-Musayyib while he was small? He said: No.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 350 - Salim Abu al-Nadr is trustworthy. 351 - Al-Salt b. Zubayd is trustworthy. 352 - Damrah b. Sa'id is trustworthy. 353 - Musa b. Uqbah, there is no harm in him. 354 - Wahb b. Kaysan is Kufan, trustworthy. 355 - It was said to Yahya while I was listening: Abdah narrated from Sa'id from Qatadah from Izrah from Sa'id b. Jubayr from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he heard a man reciting the Talbiyah on behalf of Shubrumah. The people do not agree with him on it. He said: It is Mawquf (stopped) from Sa'id, if Allah wills.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 356 - I heard Yahya say: Abdah's hearing from Sa'id was in Kufa, an age before the confusion (Ikhtilat). And Abdah is trustworthy.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 357 - Abu Khalid al-Ahmar, there is no harm in him; he was not that precise (Mutqin). 358 - And it was said to Yahya while I was listening: Isma'il b. Zakariya narrated the Hadith of Hujayyah from Ali regarding the story of al-Abbas's charity. He said: It is nothing. Isma'il b. Zakariya is Salih al-Hadith. It was said to him: So Hujayyah is the one? He said: Hujayyah is something else.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 359 - Mu'awiyah b. Yahya al-Sadafi, who narrated from al-Zuhri, and the other Mu'awiyah b. Yahya al-Atrabulsi, and Abu Muti'; they are weak, they are nothing. 360 - Qays b. al-Rabi', his Hadith is nothing. 361 - I heard Yahya say: The Hadith from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'When the prayer is established, there is no prayer except the obligatory one.' A group raises it (to the Prophet) and a group stops it (Mawquf). All of those who narrated it, there is no harm in them.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 362 - I heard Yahya say: [Regarding] Al-Darawardi from al-Ala' b. Abdur-Rahman from his father that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to Ammar: 'A transgressing group will kill you.' It was not found in the book of al-Darawardi. And the one who heard the book of al-Ala'—meaning from al-Darawardi—informed me: It was only a scroll (Sahifah), and this was not in it. It was a single story: 'The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said...' And al-Darawardi, his memory is nothing; his book is more correct.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 363 - And I heard Yahya say: Hajjaj b. Artah did not hear from al-Zuhri. 364 - And Qaza'ah b. Suwayd is Salih. 365 - Yahya b. Tha'labah Abu al-Muqawwim narrates the Hadith of the night-talk (Samar); Basran.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 366 - And Munkadir b. Muhammad b. al-Munkadir is Salih, not that strong. 367 - Ya'qub b. Muhammad b. Tahla is trustworthy (35b). 368 - Shu'ayb b. Safwan is nothing. 369 - Layth b. Sa'd is trustworthy, Saduq (truthful). 370 - Ibn Lahi'ah: No book of his was ever burnt. 371 - Layth narrated from Khalid b. Yazid, there is no harm in him; and Ibn Lahi'ah narrated from him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 372 - It was said to Abu Zakariya: Abdur-Rahman b. Ka'b b. Malik, did he meet the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace? Does he have narration? He said: No. 373 - It was said to him: Mutarrif is like al-Qa'nabi and Ma'n regarding Malik? He said: Mutarrif is trustworthy, al-Qa'nabi is trustworthy, and Ibn Nafi' is trustworthy; all of them are trustworthy. 374 - Isma'il b. Muhammad b. Sa'd is trustworthy. 375 - Muhammad b. Jabir, his Hadith is not written; he is not trustworthy. 376 - I said to him: Sa'd b. Ibrahim? He said: Trustworthy. I said to him: Like Ya'qub? He said: He is greater than Ya'qub; what would make him fall short? He is trustworthy, though I did not hear anything from him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 377 - Husayn b. Waqid is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 378 - Salam al-Tawil is not trustworthy. 379 - Salam Abu al-Mundhir, Affan narrated from him, he is not 'all that'. 380 - And Umarah b. Zadhan, there is no harm in him. 381 - Yazid b. Abdul-Malik al-Nawfali is nothing. 382 - Dawud b. Abi al-Furat, there is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 383 - Yunus b. Abi Ishaq is trustworthy, there is no harm in him. 384 - Hisham b. Ziyad is not trustworthy. 385 - His brother is trustworthy, al-Walid b. Abi Hisham; he is his brother, he is the client (Mawla) of Uthman b. Affan, may Allah be pleased with him. 386 - Umarah b. al-Qa'qa' is trustworthy. 387 - Umarah b. Abi Hafsah is trustworthy. 388 - Umarah b. Ghaziyyah, there is no harm in him. 389 - It was said to him: Does Umarah b. al-Qa'qa' from his father approximate Suhayl from his father? He said: How can Suhayl have [someone] like him?!

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 390 - It was said to him: Which is more beloved to you: Qatadah from al-Hasan from Samurah, or Suhayl from his father from Abu Hurayrah? He said: Al-Hasan did not hear from Samurah, and both of them are nothing; had al-Hasan heard from Samurah, he would have been more beloved to me. 391 - It was said to him: So did al-Hasan narrate from Ibn Mughaffal? He said: Yes. 392 - I heard Yahya say: Affan said: A man came to me—meaning he came from the people of Hadith, and Yahya raised his status, meaning Hibban b. Hilal—presenting his Hadith to me. So whenever I contradicted him in something, he would cross it out from his book, and he would not correct anything. And Affan used to narrate two thousand Hadith from Shu'bah.

book_title: From the speech of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Narrators) - Tahman's Narration
text: 393 - Yahya said: And I did not see among the companions of Shu'bah anyone with better Hadith than Abu al-Walid. 394 - It was said to him: Who was more beloved to you, Abu Dawud or Bahz? He said: Abu Dawud is trustworthy, but Bahz was more precise than him in everything. 395 - Muhammad b. Abi Humayd al-Qurashi is not trustworthy.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 396 - It was said to him, and Al-Mas'udi was mentioned, so he said: They denounced Al-Mas'udi after the death of Abu Ja'far. 397 - I heard Yahya say regarding a Hadith narrated by Abu Hanifa from Musa bin Abi Aisha from Abdullah bin Shaddad from Jabir from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: 'Whoever has an Imam, the reading of his Imam is reading for him.' He said: It is nothing; it is only Abdullah bin Shaddad.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 398 - It was said to him: Is Abu Al-Mu'ammil Sufyan bin Husain in the Hadith of Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'when he prayed the two Rak'ahs, he lay down'? He said: No, Abu Al-Mu'ammil is not (36 a) Sufyan bin Husain; he is another man.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 399 - And Shu'bah narrated three or four [Hadiths] from Sufyan bin Husain. 400 - It was said to him: Is Al-Awza'i like Malik? He said: No. It was said to him: Then Ma'mar? He said: No; Malik is the greatest of all people regarding Al-Zuhri and the most firm of them in my view. Yazid said: Everything from the speech of Yahya in this part, I heard it from Yahya; some of it I asked him about, and some of it he initiated [telling] us.

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 401 - Yazid told us, he said: I heard Abu Khaithama say: Ismail bin Ulayyah gathered the people and said to them: 'The Quran is the Speech of Allah, and whoever says the Quran is created is an innovator.' They said: 'O Abu Bishr, is it an innovation of misguidance?' He said: 'Yes, an innovation of misguidance.' 402 - I heard Abu Khaithama say: And I said to Yahya Al-Anmati at Al-Khuraybah: 'Are you satisfied with Waki'?' He said: 'Yes.' So I came to Waki' and said to him: 'This [man] claims that the Quran is created, made.' He said: 'This is a disbeliever (Kafir), this is a disbeliever.' Abu Khalid said: Ahmad bin Abi Nu'aym Al-Dawraqi added to me from Abu Khaithama, he said: He said something to him: 'Did not Allah say {We have made it}?' He said: 'This is disbelief (Kufr).'

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 403 - Ahmad bin Al-Dawraqi told us, Abu Dawood Al-Tayalisi told us, Muhammad bin Marwan Al-Qurashi told us, Abu Al-Muthanna told me from Ibn Omar that he entered the bathhouse (Hammam) while wearing a waist-wrapper, so he saw naked people, closed his eyes, and said: 'Take me out.' So he never returned to the bathhouse after that. 404 - Affan told us, Abu Awana told us, Hilal bin Khabab told us from Ikrimah, he said: Ibn Abbas used not to enter the bathhouse unless he was alone, and he used to wear a tight garment and say: 'I dislike that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, sees me stripped naked in the bathhouse.' 405 - Al-Dawraqi told us, Bashir bin Zadhan told us from Musa Ibn A'yan Al-Jazari from Sufyan Al-Thawri, he said: 'There is no Dirham that a believer spends in which there is greater reward than a Dirham he gives to the owner of the bathhouse to empty it for him.'

book_title: From the words of Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in regarding Men (Tahman's narration)
text: 406 - Shu'ja bin Makhlad told us, Hushaym told us, Mansur told us from Al-Hasan and Ibn Sirin that they both used to dislike entering the bathhouse. 407 - Shu'ja told us, Hushaym told us, he said: And Mansur used not to enter the bathhouse.
